title: Transfering and MMR
body:
Ok so a quick and simple run down of the situation this games mmr system has done to me and I'd greatly appreciate a solution to this.

I'm an Oceanic player and I've been on Oceania since riot allowed us free transfers to the server, pretty much what's happened is I've comeback to NA as I'm about to move closer to the region itself, before Oceania servers became live I played League on NA because that was my only choice at the time.

I've spent a good few years on Oceania now and accumulated a lot of wins in Normal blind pick on the server, around 3k+ games in total where my wins vastly out do my losses, again.. blind pick because we don't have normal draft available on the server.

My current predicament involves coming back to NA where my mmr for normal draft is absolutely screwed and beyond repair at this point, nothing compared to my mmr that was on Oceania and my problem with this is that my ranked mmr transferred but not my normal, so it's gone and thrown my normal mmr at around 1400-1420 which endlessly places me in games vs people not even remotely close to my level of ability and I can't seem to fix it even if I win game after game after game in a row, now I don't know for sure if this is the case but does my total games played on Oceania have to be re-accumulated to match my mmr on this server now? Because if that's the case there is seriously something wrong with your system and it's pretty much condemning my account to a state of mediocrity if I ever choose to play for.. fun?

I'd like a solution for this if possible please, something that doesn't involve me having to grind out as many matches as I did on my previous server just so I can normalize my current mmr and play vs people of equal skill, it feels unfair that because I've transferred just so I could play on better ping and now I'm in a situation where I can comeback with an account I've built over the years it's basically saying I'm not allowed to raise my normal mmr due to my previous time on another server.

Thankyou for any help or a possible solution in advance.

replies.body:
MMR is **unique** to each region, so transferring to NA from OCE after spending many years there is going to be pretty different in terms of MMR. We cannot change your MMR, but if you continue to play the same and *grind* (as you mentioned) your MMR should normalize with consistent wins and good performance. I'd also keep in mind that third-party sites cannot access your true MMR, so take the numbers they list with a grain of salt.

I'm certainly no expert when it comes to this topic, though, so you may want to post on the [Gameplay Boards](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance) for additional context and advice from other players.
